intro: Helicia shweliensis, commonly known as the Shweli helicia, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes other ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and produces small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within lowland forests. Due to its unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
